Class BuildAndCheckShipBoardController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am33.client.view.gui.viewControllers.GuiController
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am33.client.view.gui.viewControllers.BuildAndCheckShipBoardController
All Implemented Interfaces:
BoardsEventHandler
public class BuildAndCheckShipBoardController extends GuiController implements BoardsEventHandler
Controller class for managing the ship building and validation phases in the game's GUI. This controller handles all user interactions during ship construction, component placement, ship validation, and crew member assignment.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Managing component selection, placement, rotation and booking
  • Handling ship part validation and error correction
  • Coordinating crew member placement in cabins
  • Managing game timer and hourglass flips
  • Displaying visible components and prefabricated ship options
  • Processing player pawn placement for phase transitions

The controller uses JavaFX for UI updates and integrates with:

  • ModelFxAdapter for reactive data binding
  • BoardsController for board visualization
  • ClientGuiController for game state management

All UI operations are executed on the JavaFX Application Thread using Platform.runLater() to ensure thread safety.

See Also:
  • GuiController
  • BoardsEventHandler
  • ModelFxAdapter
  • ClientGuiController

  • Method Details

    • getControllerType

      public String getControllerType()
      Specified by:
      getControllerType in class GuiController

    • handleLittleDeck

      public void handleLittleDeck()
      Handles the UI event when the user selects a little deck from the combo box.

      This method:

      • Checks if at least one component has been placed on the ship board.
      • Retrieves the selected little deck index from the combo box.
      • Displays the three corresponding visible cards in the GUI.
      If no components are placed yet, an informative message is shown to the user.

    • showFocusComponent

      public void showFocusComponent()
      Shows the focused component display and control panel. Makes the component details and controls visible to the user.

    • handlePickRandomComponentButton

      public void handlePickRandomComponentButton()
      Handles the UI event when user clicks the pick random component button. Picks a random component from the hidden deck if no component is focused.

    • handleReleaseComponentButton

      public void handleReleaseComponentButton()
      Handles the UI event when user clicks the release component button. Releases the currently focused component back to the deck.

    • handleGoBackButton

      public void handleGoBackButton()
      Handles the UI event when user clicks the go back button. Hides the little deck display and returns to the main view.

    • handleRotateComponentButton

      public void handleRotateComponentButton()
      Handles the UI event when user clicks the rotate component button. Rotates the currently focused component by 90 degrees.

    • handleFlipHourglassButton

      public void handleFlipHourglassButton()
      Handles the UI event when user clicks the flip hourglass button. Restarts the game timer by flipping the hourglass.

    • getModelFxAdapter

      public ModelFxAdapter getModelFxAdapter()
      Gets the model adapter used for reactive UI updates.
      Returns:
      the ModelFxAdapter instance

    • handleEndPhaseButton

      public void handleEndPhaseButton()
      Handles the UI event when user clicks the end phase button. Ends the ship building phase and disables building elements.

    • showMessage

      public void showMessage(String message, boolean isPermanent)
      Shows a message to the user in the build and check ship board view.
      Specified by:
      showMessage in class GuiController
      Parameters:
      message - the message to display
      isPermanent - whether the message should persist or fade out

    • showInvalidComponents

      public void showInvalidComponents()
      Shows invalid components on the ship board by highlighting them in red. Sets up the correct action for handling invalid component removal.

    • showShipParts

      public void showShipParts(List<Set<Coordinates>> shipParts)
      Shows ship parts by highlighting them in different colors. Each ship part is highlighted in a different color for user selection.
      Parameters:
      shipParts - the list of ship parts to display

    • onGridButtonClick

      public void onGridButtonClick(int row, int column)
      Handles grid button clicks based on the current game state.
      Specified by:
      onGridButtonClick in interface BoardsEventHandler
      Parameters:
      row - the row coordinate of the clicked button
      column - the column coordinate of the clicked button

    • handlePlacePawnButton

      public void handlePlacePawnButton()
      Handles the UI event when user clicks the place pawn button. Places the player's pawn on the flying board to indicate readiness.

    • showFirstToEnterButton

      public void showFirstToEnterButton()
      Shows the first to enter button for the flying board. Displays the pawn placement button when the player is ready to enter the flying phase.

    • showCrewPlacementMenu

      public void showCrewPlacementMenu(boolean isPurpleSubmitted)
      Shows the crew placement menu for alien crew members. Handles the placement of purple and brown aliens in cabins with life support.
      Parameters:
      isPurpleSubmitted - whether the purple alien has already been placed

    • showDisconnectMessage

      public void showDisconnectMessage(String message)
      Displays a disconnection message to the user and terminates the application.
      Specified by:
      showDisconnectMessage in class GuiController
      Parameters:
      message - the message to be shown before exiting

    • handleConfirmCrewMemberButton

      public void handleConfirmCrewMemberButton()
      Handles the UI event when user confirms crew member placement. Processes the crew placement choices and submits them to the server.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the build and check ship board controller, called automatically by JavaFX. Sets up boards, bindings, and initial styling based on game mode.

    • handleGenerateShipBoardButton

      public void handleGenerateShipBoardButton()
      Handles the UI event when user clicks the generate ship board button. Requests a list of prefabricated ships from the server.

    • showPrefabShipBoards

      public void showPrefabShipBoards(List<PrefabShipInfo> prefabShips)
      Shows the prefabricated ship boards selection menu. Displays available prefab ships with their descriptions and selection buttons.
      Parameters:
      prefabShips - the list of available prefabricated ships

    • handleCancelPrefabSelection

      public void handleCancelPrefabSelection()
      Handles the UI event when user cancels prefab ship selection. Hides the prefab ships menu and returns to the normal view.

    • showNoMoreHiddenComponents

      public void showNoMoreHiddenComponents()
      Shows a message when no more hidden components are available. Informs the user to select from visible components instead.

    • showStolenVisibleComponent

      public void showStolenVisibleComponent()
      Shows a message when a visible component was stolen by another player. Informs the user that their selected component is no longer available.
